availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Bush (Simpson County, KY, attorney)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Edmonson County, Kentucky native. Son of Isaac Bush and Matilda Parker Bush. Married to Virginia Huston Bush on January 7, 1864. Father of Mary G. Bush. Secretary of the Kentucky Third District Democratic Convention in Bowling Green in 1859. Attorney in Simpson County in 1860. Served in the 8th Tennessee Cavalry (C.S.A.) and the 4th Tennessee Cavalry (C. S. A.) from September 27, 1862, to September 20, 1864. Attorney in Simpson County in 1864. Captured in Wilson County, Tennessee. Prisoner of war in Louisville, Kentucky. Signed loyalty oath on September 26, 1864.
